703279f-a.text:
109 Bradford Street, east side, between Fulton Street and Atlantic Ave., showing the New Lots Town Hall.  In 1937 it is the Bradford Street Hospital.  The plot (100 x 50 feet), was purchased from Horace A. Miller for $1400 and the Town Hall was opened on December 11, 1873.  The police station occupied the ground floor; the basement was used as a prison.  After 1886 it served solely as a station house.  On November 13, 1899 the present hospital was opened as the 26th Ward Homeopathic Hospital and Dispensary.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703279f-a.folder: Bradford Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY
